name: List pull requests
description:
**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    GET /repos/:owner/:repo/pulls
    

### [](#parameters)Parameters

Name

Type

Description

`state`

`string`

Either `open`, `closed`, or `all` to filter by state. Default: `open`

`head`

`string`

Filter pulls by head user and branch name in the format of `user:ref-name`. Example: `github:new-script-format`.

`base`

`string`

Filter pulls by base branch name. Example: `gh-pages`.

`sort`

`string`

What to sort results by. Can be either `created`, `updated`, `popularity` (comment count) or `long-running` (age, filtering by pulls updated in the last month). Default: `created`

`direction`

`string`

The direction of the sort. Can be either `asc` or `desc`. Default: `desc` when sort is `created` or sort is not specified, otherwise `asc`.

### [](#response)Response

    Status: 200 OK
    Link: <https://api.github.com/resource?page=2>; rel="next",
          <https://api.github.com/resource?page=5>; rel="last"

params.description: Either `open`, `closed`, or `all` to filter by state.

params.name: head
params.description: Filter pulls by head user and branch name in the format of `user:ref-name`. Example: `github:new-script-format`.

params.name: base
params.description: Filter pulls by base branch name. Example: `gh-pages`.

params.name: sort
params.description: What to sort results by. Can be either `created`, `updated`, `popularity` (comment count) or `long-running` (age, filtering by pulls updated in the last month).

params.name: direction
params.description: The direction of the sort. Can be either `asc` or `desc`.
params.default: desc when sort is created or sort is not specified, otherwise asc.

name: Get a single pull request
description:
**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    GET /repos/:owner/:repo/pulls/:number
    

### [](#response-1)Response

Each time the pull request receives new commits, GitHub creates a merge commit to _test_ whether the pull request can be automatically merged into the base branch. (This _test_ commit is not added to the base branch or the head branch.)

The value of the `merge_commit_sha` attribute changes depending on the state of the pull request. Before a pull request is merged, the `merge_commit_sha` attribute holds the SHA of the _test_ merge commit. After a pull request is merged, the attribute changes depending on how the pull request was merged:

*   If the pull request was merged as a merge commit, the attribute represents the SHA of the merge commit.
*   If the pull request was merged via a squash, the attribute represents the SHA of the squashed commit on the base branch.
*   If the pull request was rebased, the attribute represents the commit that the base branch was updated to.

The value of the `mergeable` attribute can be `true`, `false`, or `null`. If the value is `null`, this means that the mergeability hasn't been computed yet, and a background job was started to compute it. Give the job a few moments to complete, and then submit the request again. When the job is complete, the response will include a non-`null` value for the `mergeable` attribute.

Pass the appropriate [media type](/v3/media/#commits-commit-comparison-and-pull-requests) to fetch diff and patch formats.

    Status: 200 OK

name: Create a pull request
description:
**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    POST /repos/:owner/:repo/pulls
    

### [](#input)Input

Name

Type

Description

`title`

`string`

**Required**. The title of the pull request.

`head`

`string`

**Required**. The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace `head` with a user like this: `username:branch`.

`base`

`string`

**Required**. The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.

`body`

`string`

The contents of the pull request.

`maintainer_can_modify`

`boolean`

Indicates whether [maintainers can modify](https://help.github.com/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/) the pull request.

#### [](#example)Example

    {
      "title": "Amazing new feature",
      "body": "Please pull this in!",
      "head": "octocat:new-feature",
      "base": "master"
    }
    

### [](#alternative-input)Alternative Input

You can also create a Pull Request from an existing Issue by passing an Issue number instead of `title` and `body`.

Name

Type

Description

`issue`

`integer`

**Required**. The issue number in this repository to turn into a Pull Request.

#### [](#example-1)Example

    {
      "issue": 5,
      "head": "octocat:new-feature",
      "base": "master"
    }

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the pull request.

params.name: head
params.description: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace `head` with a user like this: `username:branch`.

params.name: base
params.description: The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.

params.name: body
params.description: The contents of the pull request.

params.name: maintainer_can_modify
params.description: Indicates whether [maintainers can modify](https://help.github.com/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/) the pull request.

params.name: issue
params.description: The issue number in this repository to turn into a Pull Request.

name: Update a pull request
description:
**Note:** You can now use emoji in label names, add descriptions to labels, and search for labels in a repository. See the [blog post](/changes/2018-02-22-label-description-search-preview) for full details. To access these features and receive payloads with this data during the preview period, you must provide a custom [media type](/v3/media) in the `Accept` header:

    application/vnd.github.symmetra-preview+json
    

**Warning:** The API may change without advance notice during the preview period. Preview features are not supported for production use. If you experience any issues, contact [GitHub support](https://github.com/contact).

    PATCH /repos/:owner/:repo/pulls/:number
    

### [](#input-1)Input

Name

Type

Description

`title`

`string`

The title of the pull request.

`body`

`string`

The contents of the pull request.

`state`

`string`

State of this Pull Request. Either `open` or `closed`.

`base`

`string`

The name of the branch you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot update the base branch on a pull request to point to another repository.

`maintainer_can_modify`

`boolean`

Indicates whether [maintainers can modify](https://help.github.com/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/) the pull request.

#### [](#example-2)Example

    {
      "title": "new title",
      "body": "updated body",
      "state": "open",
      "base": "master"
    }

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the pull request.

params.name: body
params.description: The contents of the pull request.

params.name: state
params.description: State of this Pull Request. Either `open` or `closed`.

params.name: base
params.description: The name of the branch you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot update the base branch on a pull request to point to another repository.

params.name: maintainer_can_modify
params.description: Indicates whether [maintainers can modify](https://help.github.com/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/) the pull request.

name: List commits on a pull request
description: **Note:** The response includes a maximum of 250 commits. To receive a complete commit list for pull requests with more than 250 commits, use the [Commit List API](/v3/repos/commits/#list-commits-on-a-repository).

name: Get if a pull request has been merged

params.name: commit_title
params.description: Title for the automatic commit message.

params.name: commit_message
params.description: Extra detail to append to automatic commit message.

params.name: sha
params.description: SHA that pull request head must match to allow merge.

params.name: merge_method
params.description: Merge method to use. Possible values are `merge`, `squash` or `rebase`. Default is `merge`.
